alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Essex, Addison, Rutland, and southwestern Orange counties through 315 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Crown Point to Rogers Rock Campground to Bolton Landing. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Rutland, Crown Point, Cornwall, Sudbury, Weybridge, Salisbury, Rutland City, Lincoln, Orwell, Benson, Chittenden, West Rutland, Whiting, Granville, Ira, West Castleton, Hancock, Shoreham, and Ripton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
